htmlData.about_facilities: Florida's Turnpike Enterprise Facilities
htmlData.about_fl_turnpike:
About Florida's Turnpike Enterprise

An innovative experiment combining the best of both the government and business worlds, Floridas Turnpike Enterprise utilizes the best practices of the private sector while operating in the public interest. Operating as a separate business unit of the Florida Department of Transportation (FDOT), Floridas Turnpike has expanded and increased revenue, while continuing to protect bondholders and improve customer service across the board. The results have been improved efficiency, cost-effectiveness and timely project delivery.

Florida's Turnpike is now responsible for all operations on every FDOT-owned and operated toll road and bridge. Floridas Turnpike strives to ensure every customer who travels these toll roads and bridges receives first class service on every trip.


Additional Information

htmlData.about_payment:
Payment Methods

SunPass

SunPass is an innovative prepaid toll program. The most convenient of all payment methods, using SunPass allows drivers to travel through toll plazas without stopping. This is accomplished by the use of a SunPass transponder, available at many retail establishments, such as Publix, CVS, AAA, and all service plazas along the Turnpike.

The transponder, once attached to the inside of the windshield, transmits a radio signal to sensors mounted in the SunPass toll lanes. As one drives through the SunPass lanes, the proper toll amount is deducted from a prepaid account.

Lastly, SunPass users pay the lowest possible toll rates, lower than the Cash and Toll-By-Plate payment methods. Also, toll lanes that accept SunPass will display the SunPass logo.

For more information on SunPass, please visit the website: SunPass



Toll-By-Plate

The toll-by-plate method is a toll collection system that takes a photo of a vehicle's license plate as it travels under tolling equipment and mails a bill for the tolls incurred over a 30-day period, plus a $2.50 administrative charge, to the registered owner of the vehicle. The benefit of toll-by-plate is that vehicles do not have to stop while travelling through toll plazas.

Turnpike systems without a Cash option will either accept toll-by-plate or SunPass payment options. The toll rates associated with toll-by-plate are always consistent with the cash toll rates.

For more information on Toll-By-Plate, please visit the website: Toll-By-Plate



Cash

Motorists paying by cash have two options: pay the exact toll amount in the 'Exact Coins Cars Only' lane or if the motorist does not have the exact toll amount or would like to obtain a receipt, the 'Change Provided' lane.

Not all 'Change Provided' lanes are staffed 24 hours a day, so motorists should be prepared to have exact change at these interchanges, especially after 7 p.m. or on weekends. Toll collection baskets in the 'Exact Coins Cars Only' lanes do not make change and drivers should not attempt to insert paper currency in the machinery. Quarters are preferred, but coin baskets accept any combination of nickels, dimes and quarters.



Ticket System

In one unique location, toll rates are based on a Ticket System. The rural area of the Florida's Turnpike, between the Three Lakes Toll Plaza in south Osceola County and the Lantana Toll Plaza in Palm Beach County, utilizes an electronically-created toll card or ticket. The ticket displays the entrance location onto the Turnpike, and the toll is calculated based on the exit location. Generally, the longer the travel, the higher the toll.

Motorists with a SunPass account are not required to obtain a ticket, and can drive through the toll booths, but must stop and wait for the gate to raise if necessary. Non-SunPass owners who use a ticket may not travel through SunPass only lanes. Motorists using the ticket payment method who travel through a SunPass only lane will receive a violation notice.
htmlData.about_service_plazas:
Service Plazas

There are eight service plazas on the Turnpike mainline, located approximately every 45 miles, which provide nighttime, armed security. The service plazas on Florida's Turnpike are open 24-hours a day and typically offer a variety of fast food dining options, gift shops, ATMs, Florida Lottery, public telephones, 24-hour news broadcasts, travel information, picnic areas, dog walks, and other amenities. Both men's and women's restrooms have changing tables and each plaza also has a family-style restroom.

htmlData.about_using_toll_cal:
Using the Toll Calculator

Toll Rates

There are two ways to view toll rates, a list based view or a map view.

LISTS

  • For those preferring a list of rates, select Lists from the Main Menu. To assist in determining which Turnpike facility to view a menu of geographical areas is provided. After selection of the area, a list of available Turnpike facilities is provided.
  • Selection of a facility provides a comprehensive list of the exits and toll, if any.

MAPS

  • For those preferring a map view, select Maps from the Main Menu. To assist in determining which Turnpike facility to view a menu of geographical areas is provided. After selection of the area, a list of available Turnpike facilities is provided.
  • Selection of a facility highlights the facility and its exits/interchanges. Tapping the exit symbol provides a summary of the tolls at that particular location.

Toll Calculator

The toll calculator is used to calculate the total toll cost between two exits (interchanges) on Turnpike facilities. Users select their start point, then their end point, and the calculator will display a summary of the total toll charge.

There are two ways to calculate the toll cost of a trip, text based and map based.

TEXT SELECTION

  • For those preferring a text based toll trip calculation, select Calculator from the Main Menu, then Text Selection. To assist in determining which Turnpike facility on which to calculate a trip a menu of geographical areas is provided. After selection of the area, a list of available Turnpike facilities is provided.
  • Selection of a facility provides a list of available starting locations. Upon selection of a start location, the user will be prompted for an end exit. Finally, a summary of the trip is displayed, including the selected start location, end location, tolls incurred on the length of the trip, and a total toll charge.

MAP SELECTION

  • For those preferring a map based toll trip calculation, select Calculator from the Main Menu, then Map Selection. To assist in determining which Turnpike facility on which to calculate a trip a menu of geographical areas is provided. After selection of the area, a list of available Turnpike facilities is provided.
  • Selection of a facility displays a map of available starting locations. Upon selection of a start location, the user will be prompted for an end exit. Finally, a summary of the trip is displayed, including the selected start location, end location, tolls incurred on the length of the trip, and a total toll charge.
